snippet: Congressional Republicans pounced Wednesday on disputed comments from Bill Clinton and a former senior Obama economic adviser as support for the push to extend Bush-era tax cuts.
abstract: Congressional Republicans seize on comments made by Bill Clinton and Lawrence H Summers that seemed to endorse extending the Bush-era tax cuts beyond their 2012 expiration date; Obama administration officials and Democrats vigorously dispute Republicans interpretation of the comments; heated exchange illustrates how politically sensitive the tax cuts have become amid fresh data showing the economy slowing.
lead_paragraph: Congressional Republicans pounced Wednesday on disputed comments from Bill Clinton and a former senior Obama economic adviser as support for the push to extend Bush-era tax cuts.

headline.seo: Comments by Clinton and Summers Spark Tax Cut Debate
headline.main: Democrats’ Comments Spark Tax Cut Debate
headline.print_headline: Democrats’ Comments Spark Tax Cut Debate
